title: RAG Quickstart Guide
content: RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) quickstart covers essential topics including document chunking strategies, metadata extraction, and vector embedding techniques. Start with preprocessing your documents into manageable chunks of 500-1000 tokens.

title: Retrieval Evaluation Best Practices
content: Evaluation tips for retrieval quality assessment. Use metrics like precision@k, recall@k, and MRR (Mean Reciprocal Rank) to measure retrieval performance. Consider using relevance judgments from domain experts.

title: Vector Database Selection
content: Choosing the right vector database depends on your scale, latency requirements, and budget. Popular options include Pinecone for managed solutions, Weaviate for hybrid search, and FAISS for in-memory operations.

title: Prompt Engineering for RAG
content: Effective prompt engineering techniques for RAG systems include context window optimization, query reformulation, and result reranking. Always include source citations in your responses to maintain transparency.

title: Hybrid Search Strategies
content: Hybrid search combines vector similarity search with traditional keyword-based BM25 ranking. This approach improves recall by capturing both semantic and lexical matches. Implement weighted fusion to balance the two methods.
